text.p: These are the leading stories in the Egyptian press on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- Mubarak says he did not attend Washington summit because of Israeli practices and Netanyahu's challenge to public opinion; says violence will continue and a disaster will happen if the suffereing of Palestinians is not ended and if the peace process does not move.
- President says underground system is a huge project that lessens the public's burden.
- Mubarak tells Ma'ariv newspaper that he did not go to Washington summit so that he would not upset Egyptian public.
- Weizman regrets Mubarak's absence from Washington summit.
- Hopelessnes among Americans and Israelis because of Mubarak's absence from summit.
- C.N.N. says Mubarak has great influence over summit despite his absence.
- Moussa and Arafat hold talks in Washington on summit issues.
- Egypt paying five billion pounds for second metro line.
- Chirac says Mubarak will soon reveal new ideas for boosting peace process.
- Palestinians pleased with Mubarak's stand on summit.
- Mubarak says absence from Washington is indication of displeasure with Israel.
